cards.front: What is the Nyquist sampling theorem?
cards.back: To perfectly reconstruct a signal, sample at fs > 2×fmax (twice the highest frequency)
When sampling below Nyquist rate, high frequencies fold back and appear as lower frequencies. It's irreversible.
Analog-to-Digital Converter: converts continuous-time signals to discrete-time (sampling + quantization)
Digital-to-Analog Converter: reconstructs continuous-time signal from discrete samples

cards.front: Why is CD audio sampled at 44.1 kHz?
cards.back: Human hearing goes up to ~20 kHz. Nyquist requires >40 kHz. 44.1 kHz provides safety margin.
Summations (Σ). The DT equivalent of ∫x(τ)dτ is Σx[k]
A lowpass filter applied before sampling to remove frequencies above Nyquist, preventing aliasing.
